snippet: Representative Charles B. Rangel’s lead grew to 945 votes over State Senator Adriano Espaillat as the Board of Elections counted absentee and affidavit ballots.
abstract: Rep Charles B Rangel's narrow lead over his main primary challenger, State Sen Adriano Espaillat, widens slightly as the New York City Board of Elections begins counting absentee and affidavit ballots from the Democratic primary in the state's 13th Congressional District.
lead_paragraph: Representative Charles B. Rangel’s lead grew to 945 votes over State Senator Adriano Espaillat as the Board of Elections counted absentee and affidavit ballots.

headline.seo: Rangel Maintains Narrow Lead as More Ballots Are Counted
headline.main: Rangel’s Slim Lead Widens as Ballot Count Continues
headline.print_headline: Slim Lead For Rangel Had Widened In Vote Count
